task_summary: Place the bread currently held by the gripper down onto the table and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style manipulator operates over a cluttered white tabletop with bottles, cans, and a tan bread-like item. The goal is to put the bread down on the table surface. The robot verifies the bread is in the gripper, moves to a safe height above the table, aligns, lowers until contact is detected, opens the gripper to release, and retreats to avoid collisions. Timing and forces are conservative to avoid knocking nearby objects.
preconditions: Bread is already grasped in the gripper
Table surface area is available for placement
stepwise_plan: Move above a table placement region
Initiate placement routine onto table surface
Lower until contact at low force threshold
success_criteria: Gripper fully released and clear of bread
Robot ends in a collision-free retreat pose
failure_and_recovery: If object not detected in gripper, abort placement and signal pick sequence
If contact not sensed in time, retry lowering once with same thresholds
If release fails, re-open gripper and slightly lift then retry
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after successful retreat following a confirmed release.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Verify the bread is currently held.
Move to a pre-place hover pose above the table.
Place the bread onto the table surface with low press force.
Lower gently until contact is detected.

failure_modes: Bread not in gripper at start
Incomplete release due to insufficient opening
recovery_strategy: Abort to pick sequence if ObjectInGripper fails
Slightly adjust approach height and retry LowerUntilContact once
Increase gripper opening and retry release
Retreat and re-approach if contact occurs too early
assumptions: The tan/brown item visible is the 'bread' and is already held at episode start
Placement target is any free spot on the table; we model it as area_id='table'
